div.p:
Educating Murray since 1906,
WE ARE MURRAY!

a.span: We are excited that today marks the first weekend-

img.alt: We are excited that today marks the first weekend-provided breakfast and lunch we sent out through Friday's lunch/breakfast service. Since the Soft Closure of our schools began, MCSD has provided more than 22,000 individual lunches and breakfasts. These pictures are distributions at Viewmont on Friday. #wearemurray #wefinishstrong

a.span: Riverview Instrumental Music Director Kellie Worwo

img.alt: Riverview Instrumental Music Director Kellie Worwood is still striking the right tone with her students each day. #wearemurray #wegotthis

a.span: Hillcrest Junior High Math Teacher Scott Hathorn m

img.alt: Hillcrest Junior High Math Teacher Scott Hathorn may not be at the school but here’s proof he’s alive and well teaching the concept of Evaluating Functions to his 9th graders. #wearemurray #wegotthis

a.span: Horizon Elementary kindergarten teacher Darle Tayl

img.alt: Horizon Elementary kindergarten teacher Darle Taylor knows how to keep things lively, encouraging each student to wear their favorite hat as she teaches them phonemic awareness of short “A” words. #wearemurray #wegotthis
McMillan Elementary sixth-grade-teachers are also poets and shared some of their inspiration. #wearemurray #wegotthis

a.span: Go here for today's MCSD update: https://bit.ly/MC

img.alt: Go here for today's MCSD update: https://bit.ly/MCSDApr13 #wearemurray #wefinishstrong

a.span: Thankfully, we haven’t had an extended Winter th

img.alt: Thankfully, we haven’t had an extended Winter this year, enabling Liberty Elementary Instructional Coach Sheri Biel and others to get her work done via their own backyard. #wearemurray #wegotthis

br.em: Please note these hours are adjusted per Salt Lake County’s Stay Home, Stay Safe order.

div.p: Murray City School District has made a change to our enrollment policy for nonresident students PS 443 “Non-Resident Students Enrollment & Graduation.” The changes are specific to the process and criteria for determining the eligibility of non-resident students with disabilities. The district invites qualified students with disabilities to apply for attendance in any of our schools. The entire explanation may be found online under Board Policy PS 443.
If you have alumni information to share, check out our Alumni News page on this website.

Results of school asbestos inspections by accredited inspectors are available for public viewing in each Murray school or at the Murray City School District Maintenance Department, 5601 South 320 West Commerce Drive; phone 801-264-7410. Asbestos re-inspections are done, as required by law every three years, with surveillance at six-month intervals.
